interactions.informationLifecycle: At the time of CDS Manifest creation, CDS Gets Vessel’s ROUTE/LINE CD information from Vessel table if GCSS does not supply the ROUTE/LINE CD
interactions.interfaceEvent: When Inbound GCSS Imports Haulage messages or WCRS amendments to the Import Haulage, are processed in CDS. f vessel information is missing in the Vessel table CDS will not accept the messages and will bypass the IPI. When Inbound GCSS Imports Haulage messages or WCRS amendments to the Import Haulage are processed in CDS, if IPI fails the VESSEL DATE RULE CDS will bypass the IPI. The VESSEL DATE RULE involves Actual and Estimated Arrival Times of the vessel retrieved from the CDS Vessel table
interactions.messageType: Vessel/voyage numbers, expected and actualy arrival date and time

interactions.informationLifecycle: WCRS amendment could be  an update to the existing B/L  or Delete the existing the B/L

interactions.alert: sends a B/L amendment notification to CDS

Queue name: RKCM.LINKS.REQUEST ( RKCMCDL module) , Local Queue manager: IQM1
RKCM.CDS.WO.REPLY
interactions.messageType: Link data from RKCM will be referred by CDS

interactions.interfaceSchedule: Whenever there are Link update/insert/delete in MEPC end
interactions.informationLifecycle:
RKCM saves the Link information from MEPC in RKCM IMS Database, which are referred by RKCM01 & RKCM02 Screens
1) Whenever MEPC inserts/updates/deletes a link data in their end, a request is placed on the queue RKCM.MEPC.LINKS.REPLICAT, which triggers the RKCMLRP job (Link Replication Program). This job will update the RKCM IMS database – which will be referred by RKCM01 screen.
2) Whenever MEPC inserts/updates/deletes a Corridor data in their end, a request is placed on the queue RKCM.MEPC.CORRIDORS.REPLICAT, which triggers the RKCMCRP job (Corridor Replication Program). This job will update the RKCM IMS database – which will be referred by RKCM02 screen
interactions.interfaceEvent: Insert(N); Update (U) ; Delete(D) Operations for Links & Corridors
interactions.interfaceDetails:
RKCM:
1) Link information(referred by RKCM01)
Queue Name: RKCM.MEPC.LINKS.REPLICAT (when messages are placed in this queue RKCMLRP job executes)
Local Queue manager: IQM1 

2) Corridor information(referred by RKCM02)
Queue Name: RKCM.MEPC.CORRIDORS.REPLICAT (when messages are placed in this queue RKCMCRP job executes)
Local Queue manager: IQM1
interactions.messageType: Link/ Corridor data from MEPC will be sent to RKCM
